p: Essential oil 1, containing mainly palmitic and myristic acids, and oil 2, containing mostly eugenol, eugenol acetate and palmitic acid, showed an antimicrobial effect within the range already described for other oils. Furthermore, some fatty acids have already been studied for antimicrobial activity, but their MIC values were not as low as expected for high activity compounds [ 30, 31]. The MIC values of myristic and palmitic acids were respectively 1600 μg/mL and >1600 μg/mL against S. aureus [ 30]. Palmitic acid was also evaluated against C. albicans with an MIC of 312.50 μg/mL [ 32], and with MIC values >256.42 μg/mL against S. pyogenes, S. aureus, E. coli and P. aeruginosa [ 33]. As can be seen in these references, the antimicrobial activity of myristic and palmitic acids always showed MIC values higher than 100 μg/mL.
